title: Graphics not displaying properly in Neural Transfer tutorial when run from Jupyter notebook.
body_html:
Issue description

In Neural Transfer tutorial, the final image does not display when running the code in a Jupyter notebook.

http://pytorch.org/tutorials/advanced/neural_style_tutorial.html#gradient-descent

The tutorial does work when running on the command line.

This is likely an issue with the way plt.imshow renders an image in a Jupyter notebook.

Code example

The problem is with the last bit of code in the tutorial:

output = run_style_transfer(cnn, content_img, style_img, input_img)

plt.figure()
imshow(output, title='Output Image')

#sphinx_gallery_thumbnail_number = 4

plt.ioff()
plt.show()

Here is a screenshot of what appears in the Jupyter notebook, instead of the expected image.

Actual:

Expected

Again, this happens only when the code is run in Jupyter notebooks, and the other images appear as expected in the tutorial.
body_text:
Issue description
In Neural Transfer tutorial, the final image does not display when running the code in a Jupyter notebook.
http://pytorch.org/tutorials/advanced/neural_style_tutorial.html#gradient-descent
The tutorial does work when running on the command line.
This is likely an issue with the way plt.imshow renders an image in a Jupyter notebook.
Code example
The problem is with the last bit of code in the tutorial:
output = run_style_transfer(cnn, content_img, style_img, input_img)

plt.figure()
imshow(output, title='Output Image')

#sphinx_gallery_thumbnail_number = 4

plt.ioff()
plt.show()
Here is a screenshot of what appears in the Jupyter notebook, instead of the expected image.

Expected

Again, this happens only when the code is run in Jupyter notebooks, and the other images appear as expected in the tutorial.
body: ## Issue description In Neural Transfer tutorial, the final image does not display when running the code in a Jupyter notebook. http://pytorch.org/tutorials/advanced/neural_style_tutorial.html#gradient-descent The tutorial does work when running on the command line. This is likely an issue with the way plt.imshow renders an image in a Jupyter notebook. ## Code example The problem is with the last bit of code in the tutorial: ```python output = run_style_transfer(cnn, content_img, style_img, input_img) plt.figure() imshow(output, title='Output Image') #sphinx_gallery_thumbnail_number = 4 plt.ioff() plt.show() ``` Here is a screenshot of what appears in the Jupyter notebook, instead of the expected image. Actual: Expected ![sphx_glr_neural_style_tutorial_004](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31841/39198593-47f7be2a-479c-11e8-8e25-0a231be750f2.png) Again, this happens only when the code is run in Jupyter notebooks, and the other images appear as expected in the tutorial.
